title: Regulation & Private Law in Banking & Financial Service
description:
This course is about the impact of regulation on the private law of banking and financial services. This would typically include how regulatory rules create private law duties in contract or tort.

It will be of interest to those interested in financial contracts, financial institutions and the regulation and supervision of financial markets and institutions including
banks. 

Financial services constitute an important sector of the economy. Financial markets and institutions including banks are subject to a rapidly expanding field of public
regulation. Its implementation and enforcement raise many underexplored challenges.
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Law Curriculum or equivalent.
preclusion: LL4376V / LL5376V / LL6376V Regulation & Private Law in Banking & Financial Service
